intro: Oberonia intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a small epiphytic orchid, typically growing on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces intricate, fragrant flowers with a distinctive yellow-green coloration. Its flowering period usually occurs during the rainy season, and it is often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Oberonia intermedia is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
